main event: Two reports of a fiery object over Casablanca, Morocco on April 5, 1956, one by a meteorological employee and another by a local resident.
interesting points: One witness described the object as a round fiery ball with an orange color and bluish edges., The object was initially thought to be a meteor., The sightings included observations of the object circling the city at low speed., The first sighting lasted for approximately 2-3 minutes., A local press article reported the object appearing in the east and disappearing to the southeast.
witness description: Employee of a meteorological station and a local resident.
